column4: ok, now I was wondering if there was a pdf reader that worked in shell
fbgs doesn't work for me
- it stuffs up
would anyone know how I could uninstall a program I've installed into /usr/local ?
if you're lucky, there's a make uninstall
how would I use that?
just like you used sudo make install
it's a recommended practice, creating the uninstall, but not all sources have it. Otherwise, manual deletion is your only other option
say I deleated the build files. could I simply untar the tarball again, configure then run make uninstall?
should work, I think I've done it in the past (I haven't done much compilation in the last few years, and I'm old and suffer brainbit rot)
thanks
my video nano works great with banshee
no, gtkpod is a techie program, banshee is a player equiv to rhythmbox
no 'better' involved, just preference
so banshee does synchronise?
yes
then gtkpod for you, if you're using mplayer for playing stuff ;)
all I needs the synchronise. or whatever that feature is called that finds all the music on your machine for copying across
try both, see which you prefer. Not like it costs anything
then gtkpod, low overhead there for sure
because if gtkpod just handles the ls, cp, mv functions of the basic shell that's not much point
